articles.author: Chris DeMars
articles.description:
This is the 3rd post in a small series we are doing on form accessibility. If you missed the 2nd post, check out Managing User Focus with :focus-visible. In this post we are going to look at using a …
Demystifying Screen Readers: Accessible Forms & Best Practices originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Demystifying Screen Readers: Accessible Forms & Best Practices

articles.description:
This is going to be the 2nd post in a small series we are doing on form accessibility. If you missed the first post, check out Accessible Forms with Pseudo Classes. In this post we are going to look …
Managing User Focus with :focus-visible originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Managing User Focus with :focus-visible

articles.author: Chris DeMars
articles.description:
Hey all you wonderful developers out there! In this post we are going to explore the use of :has() in your next web project. :has() is relatively newish but has gained popularity in the front end community by delivering control …
The Power of :has() in CSS originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: The Power of :has() in CSS

sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Pratik Joglekar)
articles.description: This article illustrates how AI can be leveraged to build tools that can be inclusive with a little bit of an additional effort.
articles.title: Using AI For Neurodiversity And Building Inclusive Tools

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Scrolling, scanning, skipping: How do users consume content online? Here’s what you need to know about reading behavior and design strategies to prevent harmful scanning patterns. An upcoming part of Smart Interface Design Patterns.
articles.title: F-Shape Pattern And How Users Read

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Leonardo Losoviz)
articles.description: What options do we have for integrating GraphQL with WordPress in 2024? Leonardo Losoviz describes the developments that have taken place in this space over the last three years.
articles.title: How To Work With GraphQL In WordPress In 2024

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alexis Kypridemos)
articles.description: What do you do when you need to convert plain text into formatted HTML? Perhaps you reach for Markdown or manually write in the element tags yourself. Or maybe you have one or two of the dozens of online tools that will do it for you. In this tutorial, Alexis Kypridemos picks those tools apart and details the steps for how we can do it ourselves with a little vanilla HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
articles.title: Converting Plain Text To Encoded HTML With Vanilla JavaScript

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Matt Zeunert)
articles.description: The three Core Web Vitals metrics don’t only tell you how visitors experience your website but also impact your Google search result rankings. In this article, we’ll look at what Core Web Vitals are, how they are measured, and how you can use DebugBear to monitor them continuously.
articles.title: How To Monitor And Optimize Google Core Web Vitals

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: Creating 3D effects in CSS isn’t an entirely new concept, but typical approaches use additional elements in the markup and pseudo-elements in the styles to pull it off. Temani Afif applies 3D effects and sliding transitions to a single `` using clever CSS techniques that demonstrate advanced, modern styling practices.
articles.title: Sliding 3D Image Frames In CSS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Mikołaj Dobrucki)
articles.description: Penpot helps designers and developers work better together by offering a free, open-source design tool based on open web standards. Today, let's explore Penpot’s latest feature, CSS Grid Layout. Penpot’s latest release is about efficiency and so much more. It gives designers superpowers and a better place at the table. Excited? Let’s take a look at it together.
articles.title: Penpot’s CSS Grid Layout: Designing With Superpowers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Victor Yocco)
articles.description: Victor Yocco reviews the components of the Transactional Model of communication, explaining how we might apply this framework to preparing, conducting, and analysing our UX research. You will understand how many UX research best practices align with the model and get an example of a tool for tracking alignment.
articles.title: Connecting With Users: Applying Principles Of Communication To UX Research

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Preethi Sam)
articles.description: What can we do to make a mobile app better? What subsidiary features are worth providing for our users? I have some ideas. You might, too. So, let’s compare our notes. Without any prescriptions attached, here are seven features I believe can palpably improve a user’s experience with a mobile app.
articles.title: The Things Users Would Appreciate In Mobile Apps

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Tatsiana Tarkan)
articles.description: Tatsiana Tarkan digs deep into iconography as part of a design system and shares some doable tips that will turn icon creation and maintenance into an enjoyable process.
articles.title: Iconography In Design Systems: Easy Troubleshooting And Maintenance

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Silvestar Bistrović)
articles.description: Remember the HTML `` element? It’s deprecated, so it’s not like you’re going to use it when you need some sort of horizontal auto-scrolling feature. That’s where CSS comes in because it has all the tools we need to pull it off. Silvestar Bistrović demonstrates a technique that makes it possible with a set of images and as little HTML as possible.
articles.title: Infinite-Scrolling Logos In Flat HTML And Pure CSS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Could there be a better way to welcome the new month than with a little inspiration boost? We might have one for you: desktop wallpapers created by the community for the community. Enjoy!
articles.title: Colorful Blossoms And Rainy Days (April 2024 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Victor Ayomipo)
articles.description: There’s no shortage of articles about the mental health of developers, ranging from personal accounts of harrowing work experiences to round-ups of advice on how to preserve healthy work habits. But what working situations trigger things like stress, anxiety, burnout, and depression? Victor Ayomipo shares his personal triggers and how he manages them.
articles.title: How Developers Can Strengthen Their Mental Health Amidst High-Pressure Projects

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Based on responses from over 1,200 product professionals, Maze’s Future of User Research Report uncovers how product teams conduct research to inform decision-making and build successful products. Learn about the top three trends defining the user research industry in 2024 and beyond.
articles.title: The Future Of User Research: Expert Insights And Key Trends

articles.author: oghenekparobo stephen
articles.description: In this article, we'll explore the process of creating JSON Web Tokens (JWTs) from scratch in PHP, presenting a superior and more secure authentication scheme.  By implementing this advanced approach, we unveil a robust and highly secure authentication mechanism that significantly enhances data protection and user authentication. Table Of
articles.title: How to Implement JSON Web Tokens (JWTs) in PHP – PHP Authentication Guide

articles.author: Anshul Sanghi
articles.description: In this handbook, you'll learn about procedural macros in Rust, and what purposes they serve. You'll also learn how to write your own procedural macros with both hypothetical and real-world examples. This guide assumes that you're familiar with Rust and its basic concepts, such as data-types, iterators, and traits. If
articles.title: Procedural Macros in Rust – A Handbook for Beginners

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Are you ready to master Webflow and build stunning websites without writing a single line of code? We just posted a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will guide you through everything you need to know about Webflow. Ashokkumar Chava...
articles.title: Webflow Crash Course

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Creating a Google Photos clone will help you learn a lot about web development. We just posted a video course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you how to create a powerful photo management app using Next.js and Cloudinary. Colb...
articles.title: Create a Google Photos Clone with Next.js and Cloudinary

articles.author: Estefania Cassingena Navone
articles.description: Building websites that look great on any device – like a phone, tablet, or computer screen – is what responsive web development is all about. In this course, you will learn how to build a responsive website step by step in Spanish using HTML and CSS....
articles.title: Build a Responsive Website with HTML and CSS - Course in Spanish

articles.author: Damilola Oladele
articles.description: Object-oriented programming (OOP) is a style of programming that heavily relies on objects. These objects can have attributes and methods. While attributes store data, methods define behavior. Like many other programming languages, Python supports both OOP and functional programming. However, OOP becomes valuable when writing large-sized and complex programs. In
articles.title: How to Use Object-Oriented Programming in Python – Explained With Examples

articles.author: Jaja Ibifubara David
articles.description: In a world where we're constantly glued to screens and distracted by digital noise, it's easy to forget about nature.  But here's the exciting part: biophilic design offers a cool solution. Usually, it's all about bringing nature into buildings, but now nature is branching out into web design as
articles.title: What is Biophilic Design? How to Reconnect with Nature through Web Design

articles.author: Fanny Nyayic
articles.description: In my previous article, "How to Create a Responsive HTML Email Template [/news/how-to-create-a-responsive-html-email-template/]," we explored the fundamentals of designing and coding a simple HTML email template that adapts beautifully across different devices and email clients.  I got a couple of questions about adding media to the HTML email template.
articles.title: How to Add Media to Your HTML Email Template

articles.author: Kayode Adeniyi
articles.description: These days, software is being developed and deployed at a very rapid pace. It makes it easy to understand how the saying “move fast and break things” became commonplace.  In an era where agile development is the go-to practice for quick feature releases and feedback, it's easy for security
articles.title: How Feature Flags and Role-Based Access Control Can Help Secure Your DevOps Process

articles.author: Yogesh Chavan
articles.description: In this tutorial, you will learn the easiest and most efficient way to debug Node.js application code. So let's get started. Want to watch the video version of this tutorial? You can check out the video below: Table Of Contents  * How You Usually Debug Node.js Applications  *
articles.title: How to Debug Node.js Applications Using the debugger; Statement
